questions.question: Which transformation changes the size of an object but keeps its shape?
A shear transformation will:
options: a. Tilt an object while keeping one side fixed
b. Flip the shape over an axis
d. Rotate the shape about the origin
questions.correctAnswer: a. Tilt an object while keeping one side fixed

questions.question: If a transformation preserves the shape and size of an object, it is:

options: d. Scaling by -1 in the y-direction

questions.question: Scaling is defined by which two parameters?
options: a. Angle and axis of rotation

questions.question: Which transformation has no fixed points except when the distance moved is zero?
A triangle is rotated 180° about the origin. What is the image of the point $(3,-2)$?
A figure is enlarged by a scale factor of 3 with respect to the origin. The point $(4,-1)$ maps to:
Which sequence of transformations could map a flag at $(2,3)$ to $(-2,-3)$?
options: a. Reflection across the y-axis, then reflection across the x-axis
c. Scaling by factor 2, then reflection across y-axis
questions.correctAnswer: a. Reflection across the y-axis, then reflection across the x-axis

questions.question: If a transformation preserves angles but changes lengths, it is:
Which of the following best describes tessellation?
options: a. The art of folding paper into shapes
b. A pattern that covers a surface without gaps or overlaps
c. A pattern that repeats in three dimensions only
d. The study of plant growth patterns
questions.correctAnswer: b. A pattern that covers a surface without gaps or overlaps

questions.question: Which of the following shapes can form a regular tessellation?
Which of the following is not a regular polygon that can tessellate by itself?
Which type of symmetry is common in tessellations?
Which real-life example is an irregular tessellation?
options: b. M. C. Escher's artwork of interlocking birds and fish
d. Tiled bathroom floor made of identical hexagons
questions.correctAnswer: b. M. C. Escher's artwork of interlocking birds and fish

questions.question: Which tessellation type is formed by repeating a square in a grid pattern?
A tiling pattern uses two regular polygons: squares and equilateral triangles. What type of tessellation is it?
Which property ensures that a shape can tessellate the plane?
options: a. Its interior angles divide evenly into 180°
b. Its interior angles sum to 180°
c. Its interior angles divide evenly into 360°
d. It has more than 4 sides
questions.correctAnswer: c. Its interior angles divide evenly into 360°

questions.question: A brick wall pattern uses rectangles in rows, with each row offset from the previous one. This is an example of:
What is a frieze pattern?
options: a. A pattern that covers a whole plane without gaps
b. A repeating pattern that extends infinitely in one direction
c. A design made with circles
questions.correctAnswer: b. A repeating pattern that extends infinitely in one direction

questions.question: How many types of frieze patterns are there according to symmetry classification?

Which of the following best defines the Golden Ratio?
options: a. The sum of two numbers divided by the larger is equal to the larger divided by the smaller
b. The product of two numbers equals their sum
c. The sum of two numbers equals the square of the larger number
d. The difference between two numbers equals the smaller number
questions.correctAnswer: a. The sum of two numbers divided by the larger is equal to the larger divided by the smaller

questions.question: Which is the main difference between a fractal and a regular polygon?
options: b. Fractals show infinite detail at different scales, polygons do not
c. Polygons are irregular, fractals are always regular
questions.correctAnswer: b. Fractals show infinite detail at different scales, polygons do not
